objects.title: Visual requirements overview
objects.description:
Users shall have a visual overview of all requirements in the
workspace without needing to open individual files.

objects.title: Quick status awareness
objects.description:
Users shall be able to quickly assess the status of their
requirements project (counts, health, configuration state).

objects.title: Efficient requirement discovery
objects.description:
Users shall be able to find specific requirements quickly through
filtering, searching, and organized grouping.

objects.title: Quick relation view
objects.description:
The user shall be able to see relationships between items
through the UI components, both incoming and outgoing relationships
for one selected item.

objects.title: Tree view sidebar
objects.description:
The extension shall provide a tree view in the VS Code sidebar
titled "REQUIREMENTS EXPLORER" showing all indexed requirements.

objects.title: Tree view grouping modes
objects.description:
The tree view shall support grouping requirements by:

- Type (default): Requirements, Rationales, Information, etc.
- Level: Stakeholder, System, Component, etc.
- File: Grouped by source file path
- Status: Draft, Review, Approved, etc.
- Baseline: Grouped by baseline version

objects.title: Tree view item display
objects.description:
Tree items shall display:

``[status-icon] ID - Title [level] [status]``

Example: ``[tick] 00001 - Single source of truth [stakeholder] [approved]``

objects.title: Status icons
objects.description:
Status shall be indicated by icons:

- Draft: pencil icon
- Review: eye icon
- Approved: checkmark icon
- Implemented: rocket icon
- Deprecated: x-mark icon

objects.title: Tree item click navigation
objects.description:
Clicking a tree item shall navigate to the requirement's
definition location in the editor.

objects.title: Tree item context menu
objects.description:
Right-click context menu shall provide:

- Go to Definition
- Find All References
- Show Dependencies (outgoing links)
- Show Dependents (incoming links)
- Add Baseline Tag
- Copy ID to Clipboard

objects.title: Tree view filtering
objects.description:
The tree view shall provide a filter/search bar:

- Filter by ID substring
- Filter by title keywords
- Filter by type, level, status
- Clear filter button

objects.title: Tree view actions
objects.description:
Tree view toolbar shall include:

- Refresh button
- Collapse all button
- Group by selector
- Filter toggle

objects.title: Orphaned requirements section
objects.description:
Tree view shall include a special "Orphaned" section showing
requirements with no links (when any exist).

objects.title: Tree view example structure
objects.description:
Example tree structure (grouped by type):

.. code-block:: text

   REQUIREMENTS EXPLORER
   +-- Requirements (42)
   |   +-- [tick] 00001 - Single source... [stakeholder] [approved]
   |   +-- [pencil] 00002 - Zero config... [stakeholder] [draft]
   |   +-- ...
   +-- Rationales (8)
   |   +-- 00003 - Rationale for...
   |   +-- ...
   +-- Information (12)
   +-- Parameters (5)
   +-- Design Elements (15)
   +-- Orphaned (3)
       +-- 00099 - No links

objects.title: Relationship explorer panel
objects.description:
The extension shall provide a relationship explorer panel in the VS Code sidebar
titled "RELATIONSHIP EXPLORER" showing all incoming and outgoing relationships
for one selected item.

objects.title: Relationship explorer item display
objects.description:
Explorer items shall display:

``[direction-icon] ID - Title [level] [status]``

objects.title: Relationship explorer item selection
objects.description:
Explorer items shall display relationships for the currently selected
requirement in the Requirements Explorer.

objects.title: Relationship explorer navigation
objects.description:
When clicking the relationship explorer items, the extension shall navigate
to the requirement's definition location in the editor, and make the Requirements
Explorer select that item.

objects.title: Selected item displayed
objects.description:
The relationship explorer panel shall prominently display the currently
selected requirement at the top of the panel, including its ID, title,
level, and status.

objects.title: Status bar item
objects.description:
The extension shall display a status bar item showing:

- Extension name/icon
- Requirement count
- Configuration status

objects.title: Status bar ready state
objects.description:
When operating normally, status bar shall show:

``Rigr: Ready (N objects)``

Where N is the total indexed requirement count.

objects.title: Status bar error state
objects.description:
When configuration error occurs, status bar shall show:

``Rigr: Config Error``

Clicking shall show error details.

objects.title: Status bar indexing state
objects.description:
During indexing, status bar shall show:

``Rigr: Indexing... (N/M files)``

With progress indication.

objects.title: Status bar click action
objects.description:
Clicking the status bar item shall show a quick pick menu:

- Show Requirements Explorer
- Reload Configuration
- Run Deep Validation
- Generate Release Report
- Open Settings

objects.title: Status bar baseline indicator
objects.description:
When baseline filter is active, status bar shall show:

``Rigr: v1.0.0 (87 reqs)``

objects.title: Initial indexing notification
objects.description:
During initial workspace scan, a progress notification shall show:

- "Rigr: Indexing requirements..."
- Progress bar or percentage
- Cancel button for large workspaces

objects.title: Deep validation progress
objects.description:
During deep validation, a progress notification shall show:

- Current analysis phase
- Cancel button
- Estimated completion (if available)

objects.title: Operation completion notifications
objects.description:
Upon completion of operations, show notification:

- "Indexed N requirements in M files"
- "Baseline v1.0.0 tagged on N requirements"
- "Deep validation complete - view report"

objects.title: Configuration error display
objects.description:
Configuration errors shall be displayed via:

- Status bar error indicator
- Notification with "View Error" action
- Output channel with detailed error

objects.title: Validation results display
objects.description:
Validation errors shall be displayed via:

- Inline editor decorations (squiggles)
- Problems panel entries
- Tree view warning badges (optional)

objects.title: Output channel
objects.description:
The extension shall provide an output channel "Rigr" for:

- Detailed error messages
- Debug information
- Operation logs

objects.title: Command palette commands
objects.description:
The following commands shall be available via Ctrl+Shift+P:

- Rigr: Reload Configuration
- Rigr: Deep Validation
- Rigr: Tag Current Baseline
- Rigr: Remove Baseline Tags
- Rigr: Generate Release Report
- Rigr: Create Git Tag for Baseline
- Rigr: New Project
- Rigr: Show Requirements Explorer
- Rigr: Show Output

objects.title: Command descriptions
objects.description:
Each command shall have a clear description displayed in the
command palette for discoverability.

objects.title: Default keyboard shortcuts
objects.description:
Default keyboard shortcuts shall be provided:

- F12: Go to Definition (standard VS Code)
- Alt+F12: Peek Definition (standard VS Code)
- Shift+F12: Find All References (standard VS Code)

objects.title: Customizable shortcuts
objects.description:
All Rigr commands shall be customizable via VS Code keyboard
shortcuts settings (keybindings.json).

objects.title: Settings contribution
objects.description:
The extension shall contribute settings to VS Code Settings UI
under a "Rigr" category with:

- Validation settings
- Tree view preferences
- Performance settings

objects.title: Settings descriptions
objects.description:
Each setting shall have:

- Clear description
- Default value shown
- Valid values/ranges documented

objects.title: Deep validation report webview
objects.description:
Deep validation results shall be displayed in a webview panel:

- Interactive HTML report
- Clickable links to requirements
- Collapsible sections
- Export options

objects.title: Traceability matrix webview
objects.description:
Traceability matrix shall be displayed in a webview:

- Interactive grid
- Hover details
- Click to navigate
- Filter controls

objects.title: Dependency graph webview
objects.description:
Dependency graph visualization shall use a webview:

- SVG/Canvas rendering
- Pan and zoom
- Node click navigation
- Layout options

objects.title: Documentation preview capability
objects.description:
Users shall be able to build and preview the Sphinx documentation
output directly from VS Code to verify how requirements will appear
in the generated documentation.

objects.title: Build documentation command
objects.description:
The extension shall provide a command "Rigr: Build Documentation"
that invokes the Sphinx build process:

- Locate conf.py using existing discovery mechanism
- Execute ``sphinx-build -b html <source> <build>`` command
- Display build progress in notification
- Show build output in dedicated output channel
- Report success or failure with actionable message

objects.title: Build command prerequisites
objects.description:
Before building, the command shall verify:

- conf.py exists in workspace
- Python is available (python3 or python)
- sphinx-build command is accessible

If prerequisites are not met, display helpful error message
with installation instructions.

objects.title: Build output location
objects.description:
The build command shall output to a standard location:

- Default: ``_build/html`` relative to conf.py directory
- Respect existing Sphinx configuration if specified
- Create output directory if it does not exist

objects.title: Build error handling
objects.description:
On build failure, the extension shall:

- Display error notification with "Show Output" action
- Log full error details to output channel
- Parse Sphinx error messages to show file and line if available

objects.title: View documentation command
objects.description:
The extension shall provide a command "Rigr: View Documentation"
that opens the generated documentation in the default web browser:

- Locate index.html in the build output directory
- Open using system default browser via VS Code API
- If documentation not yet built, prompt user to build first

objects.title: View command file detection
objects.description:
The view command shall locate the documentation entry point:

- Check ``_build/html/index.html`` relative to conf.py
- Fall back to ``build/html/index.html`` if exists
- Report clear error if no built documentation found

objects.title: Build and view workflow
objects.description:
The extension shall support a streamlined workflow:

- "Build Documentation" automatically offers to view on success
- "View Documentation" offers to build if output is stale or missing
- Status bar shows last build timestamp when documentation exists

objects.title: Presentation of items in the generated Sphinx document
objects.description:
The generated Sphinx documentation shall present each item according to
below:
- <Title> as a header of the item
- Table containing:
-- ID <id> 
-- Type <type>
-- Level <level> (In plain text)
-- Status <status> (In plain text)
- All incoming and outgoing relationships, one table row per "relation type" and direction.
- <Description> as the main content body

objects.title: Theme of items in the generated Sphinx document
objects.description:
The item in the generated Sphinx documentation shall follow the Theme
as configured in the Rigr settings for Sphinx documentation generation.

Example themes are:
- Sphinx default theme
- Alabaster
- Read the Docs

objects.title: Embed graphics in documentation
objects.description:
Users shall be able to embed graphics such as images and diagrams
in the requirements documentation, displayed at their full size
without being constrained by item containers.

objects.title: Graphic directive for images
objects.description:
The Sphinx extension shall provide a ``.. graphic::`` directive that:

- Accepts image files (PNG, JPG, SVG, GIF) via ``:file:`` option
- Displays images at full width (100% of content area)
- Supports caption (argument) and ID for cross-referencing
- Integrates with the configured Sphinx theme

objects.title: Graphic directive for PlantUML diagrams
objects.description:
The ``.. graphic::`` directive shall support inline PlantUML:

- PlantUML code in the directive body (between @startuml/@enduml)
- Renders diagrams at full width (100% of content area)
- Supports caption and ID for cross-referencing
- Uses the configured PlantUML renderer (local or server)

objects.title: Graphic presentation format
objects.description:
The generated Sphinx documentation shall present each graphic item according to
below:
- Consistent styling that follows the configured theme
- <Title> as a header of the graphic item
- Table containing:
-- ID <id> 
- All incoming and outgoing relationships, one table row per "relation type" and direction.
- <Actual graphic>
-- Clickable to view full-size in a new tab
-- Full-width display
- Caption displayed below the graphic

objects.title: Embed code blocks in documentation
objects.description:
Users shall be able to embed code blocks (source code, configuration,
scripts, etc.) in the requirements documentation as referenceable objects
that can be traced to from requirements, specifications, and other items.

objects.title: Code directive for source code
objects.description:
The Sphinx extension shall provide a ``.. code::`` directive that:

- Accepts a programming language via ``:language:`` option (e.g., python, c, java, rust, xml)
- Renders code with syntax highlighting using the Sphinx/Pygments code highlighter
- Supports an ``:id:`` option for cross-referencing from other items
- Supports a ``:caption:`` option for a description below the code
- Supports all link options (satisfies, implements, etc.) for traceability
- The code content is placed in the directive body

objects.title: Code presentation format
objects.description:
The generated Sphinx documentation shall present each code item according to
below:
- Consistent styling that follows the configured theme
- <Title> as a header of the code item
- Table containing:
-- ID <id>
- All incoming and outgoing relationships, one table row per "relation type" and direction.
- <Actual code block> with syntax highlighting for the specified language
- Caption displayed below the code

objects.title: Code and Graphic directives in completion menu
objects.description:
The VS Code extension completion menu shall offer snippets for:

- ``.. graphic::`` directive with auto-generated ID, language/file options
- ``.. code::`` directive with auto-generated ID, language option, and body placeholder

These shall appear alongside the existing ``.. item::`` snippets when the user
triggers autocompletion at a directive position.

objects.title: Code and Graphic in explorers
objects.description:
Code and Graphic objects shall be visible in:

- The Requirements Explorer tree view (grouped by type, level, or status)
- The Relationships Explorer (showing incoming/outgoing links)

They shall be navigable (click to go to source) and display their
ID, title, and relationships just like regular items.

objects.title: TreeDataProvider implementation
objects.description:
The TreeDataProvider component shall:

- Implement VS Code TreeDataProvider interface
- Subscribe to index updates for refresh
- Support multiple grouping strategies
- Provide tree items with icons and descriptions

objects.title: StatusBarManager implementation
objects.description:
The StatusBarManager component shall:

- Create and manage status bar item
- Update text based on extension state
- Handle click actions with quick pick
- Show progress during operations

objects.title: WebviewProvider implementation
objects.description:
The WebviewProvider component shall:

- Create webview panels for reports
- Generate HTML content from templates
- Handle message passing for interactivity
- Support export functionality

objects.title: Rigr extension architecture
objects.description:
The Rigr extension follows a layered architecture with clear separation of concerns:

- **Configuration Layer**: Loads and manages configuration from conf.py and VS Code settings
- **Indexing Layer**: Parses RST files and maintains an in-memory index
- **Provider Layer**: Implements VS Code language features (completion, hover, etc.)
- **Validation Layer**: Performs automatic and deep validation analysis
- **Views Layer**: Provides UI components (tree view, status bar)
- **Commands Layer**: Implements user commands for validation, baselines, reports

objects.title: Rigr Extension Component Architecture
objects.description:
@startuml Rigr Architecture
skinparam componentStyle uml2
skinparam backgroundColor #FEFEFE

package "VS Code Extension Host" {
  [extension.ts] as EXT
  note right of EXT : Entry point\nActivation & registration
}

package "Configuration Layer" <<Rectangle>> {
  [ConfigLoader] as CL
  [SettingsManager] as SM
  [defaults.ts] as DEF
  CL --> DEF : fallback
  SM --> DEF : defaults
}

package "Indexing Layer" <<Rectangle>> {
  [RstParser] as RST
  [IndexBuilder] as IB
  [IndexCache] as IC
  RST --> IB : parsed objects
  IB --> IC : persist/load
}

package "Provider Layer" <<Rectangle>> {
  [CompletionProvider] as CP
  [HoverProvider] as HP
  [DefinitionProvider] as DP
  [ReferenceProvider] as RP
  [DiagnosticProvider] as DGP
  [CodeActionProvider] as CAP
}

package "Validation Layer" <<Rectangle>> {
  [DeepValidationRunner] as DVR
  [CircularDependencyDetector] as CDD
  [HierarchicalCoverageAnalyzer] as HCA
  [OrphanDetector] as OD
  [StatusConsistencyValidator] as SCV
  [CompletenessAnalyzer] as CA
  [GapAnalyzer] as GA
  DVR --> CDD
  DVR --> HCA
  DVR --> OD
  DVR --> SCV
  DVR --> CA
  DVR --> GA
}

package "Views Layer" <<Rectangle>> {
  [TreeViewProvider] as TVP
  [StatusBar] as SB
}

package "Commands Layer" <<Rectangle>> {
  [ValidationCommand] as VC
  [BaselineCommands] as BC
  [ReportCommands] as RC
  [ProjectCommands] as PC
}

package "Utilities" <<Rectangle>> {
  [IdGenerator] as IG
  [GraphAnalysis] as GRA
}

' Main connections
EXT --> CL : load config
EXT --> SM : settings
EXT --> IB : create index
EXT --> CP : register
EXT --> HP : register
EXT --> DP : register
EXT --> RP : register
EXT --> DGP : register
EXT --> CAP : register
EXT --> TVP : register
EXT --> VC : register
EXT --> BC : register
EXT --> RC : register
EXT --> PC : register

' Provider dependencies
CP --> IB : query
HP --> IB : query
DP --> IB : query
RP --> IB : query
DGP --> IB : query
DGP --> RST : parse
CAP --> IB : query

' Command dependencies
VC --> DVR : run
RC --> IB : query
BC --> IB : query

' Utility dependencies
DVR --> GRA : graph ops
CP --> IG : next ID

' View dependencies
TVP --> IB : subscribe

@enduml

metadata.caption: Component diagram showing the VS Code extension architecture layers and their interactions.

objects.title: Extension entry point
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/extension.ts``

The extension entry point handles:

- Extension activation and VS Code API registration
- Configuration loading with fallback to defaults
- Index builder initialization and cache management
- Provider registration (completion, hover, definition, etc.)
- Command registration (validation, baseline, reports)
- Status bar creation and updates
- File watcher setup for automatic re-indexing
- Configuration change event handling

objects.title: ConfigLoader component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/configuration/configLoader.ts``

Loads Rigr configuration from Sphinx conf.py:

- Searches for conf.py in docs/, doc/, source/, or workspace root
- Executes embedded Python script to extract configuration as JSON
- Parses rigr_object_types, rigr_levels, rigr_id_config, rigr_link_types, rigr_statuses
- Falls back to default configuration on parse failure
- Supports legacy rigr_id_prefixes for backwards compatibility

objects.title: SettingsManager component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/configuration/settingsManager.ts``

Manages VS Code extension settings:

- Reads rigr.validation.* settings (automatic, onSave, debounceMs)
- Reads rigr.treeView.* settings (groupBy, showStatusIcons)
- Reads rigr.indexing.* settings (maxFiles, excludePatterns)
- Provides typed getters for all settings
- Emits change events when settings are modified

objects.title: Default configuration
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/configuration/defaults.ts``

Provides default configuration values:

- Default object types: requirement, rationale, information, parameter, design_element
- Default levels: stakeholder, system, component, software, hardware
- Default link types: satisfies/satisfied_by, implements/implemented_by, etc.
- Default statuses: draft, review, approved, implemented, deprecated
- Default ID config: 5-digit padding, no prefix
- Helper functions for type/level/status lookups

objects.title: RstParser component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/indexing/rstParser.ts``

Parses RST files for requirement directives:

- Regex-based parsing for ``.. item::`` directives
- Extracts field list options (:id:, :type:, :level:, :status:, etc.)
- Handles multi-line descriptions with proper indentation tracking
- Detects inline ``:item:`ID``` references in description text
- Reports parse errors with line numbers
- Context detection for completion triggers (link fields, inline refs)

**Test file**: ``src/indexing/rstParser.test.ts``

objects.title: IndexBuilder component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/indexing/indexBuilder.ts``

Builds and maintains the requirement index:

- Primary index: Map<id, RequirementObject>
- Secondary indexes: fileIndex, typeIndex, levelIndex, statusIndex
- Bidirectional link graph with automatic reverse link computation
- Baseline index for release filtering
- Full workspace scan with progress reporting
- Incremental updates on file change events
- File system watchers for automatic re-indexing
- Respects exclude patterns from settings

objects.title: IndexCache component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/indexing/indexCache.ts``

Persists index to disk for faster startup:

- Saves to ``.vscode/requirements-index.json``
- Includes version, timestamp, and config hash for invalidation
- Validates cache against file modification times
- Handles corrupted cache gracefully (triggers rebuild)

objects.title: CompletionProvider component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/providers/completionProvider.ts``

Provides intelligent autocompletion:

- Triggers on ".." for new item snippets
- Triggers in link field context for ID completion
- Triggers on ``:item:``` for inline references
- Generates dynamic snippets from configured object types
- Auto-generates next available unique ID
- Displays ID, title, type, level, status in completion items
- Fuzzy filtering on ID and title
- Documentation preview with full description

objects.title: HoverProvider component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/providers/hoverProvider.ts``

Shows requirement details on hover:

- Detects requirement ID under cursor
- Displays formatted Markdown with all metadata
- Shows type, level, status, baseline
- Shows description (truncated if long)
- Lists all links grouped by link type
- Shows file location with line number

objects.title: DefinitionProvider component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/providers/definitionProvider.ts``

Enables go-to-definition navigation:

- F12 / Ctrl+Click to jump to definition
- Works from link field values
- Works from inline ``:item:``` references
- Returns Location for VS Code navigation

objects.title: ReferenceProvider component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/providers/referenceProvider.ts``

Finds all references to a requirement:

- Shift+F12 to show all references
- Includes definition location
- Includes all link field references
- Includes all inline text references
- Returns Location array for references panel

objects.title: DiagnosticProvider component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/providers/diagnosticProvider.ts``

Provides real-time validation diagnostics:

- Validates on file save (debounced)
- Detects broken links (ERROR)
- Detects duplicate IDs (ERROR)
- Detects invalid type values (ERROR)
- Detects invalid level values (ERROR)
- Detects invalid status values (WARNING)
- Detects missing required fields (WARNING)
- Maps diagnostic types to VS Code severities
- Creates diagnostics with proper ranges

objects.title: CodeActionProvider component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/providers/codeActionProvider.ts``

Provides quick fix suggestions:

- "Create requirement [ID]" for broken links
- "Remove link" for broken links
- Change to valid type/level/status values
- Generates WorkspaceEdit for automatic fixes

objects.title: DeepValidationRunner component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/validation/deepValidationRunner.ts``

Orchestrates comprehensive deep validation:

- Runs all validation checks in sequence
- Aggregates findings from all analyzers
- Generates structured DeepValidationReport
- Computes summary statistics (blocker, high, medium, low counts)
- Generates gap recommendations

**Test file**: ``src/validation/deepValidation.test.ts``

objects.title: CircularDependencyDetector component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/validation/circularDependencyDetector.ts``

Detects cycles in the dependency graph:

- Implements cycle detection algorithm
- Identifies minimal cycles
- Reports full cycle paths
- Classifies by severity (direct vs. longer cycles)

**Test file**: ``src/validation/circularDependencyDetector.test.ts``

objects.title: HierarchicalCoverageAnalyzer component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/validation/hierarchicalCoverageAnalyzer.ts``

Calculates traceability coverage metrics:

- Computes coverage per level transition
- Calculates forward and backward coverage
- Groups by link type (satisfies, implements, etc.)
- Identifies specific coverage gaps
- Applies configurable thresholds

objects.title: OrphanDetector component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/validation/orphanDetector.ts``

Identifies orphaned requirements:

- True orphans: no links at all
- Dead-end items: incoming only (leaf nodes)
- Source items: outgoing only (root nodes)
- Categorizes severity by priority

objects.title: StatusConsistencyValidator component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/validation/statusConsistencyValidator.ts``

Validates status consistency across links:

- Detects approved depending on draft
- Detects implemented depending on review
- Validates status transitions
- Reports inconsistency chains

objects.title: CompletenessAnalyzer component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/validation/completenessAnalyzer.ts``

Verifies hierarchical completeness:

- Complete chain verification (stakeholder -> ... -> test)
- Missing level detection
- Bidirectional traceability validation
- Priority-weighted coverage calculation
- Baseline stability analysis
- Baseline leakage detection

objects.title: GapAnalyzer component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/validation/gapAnalyzer.ts``

Generates actionable gap recommendations:

- Identifies missing implementations
- Identifies orphaned implementations
- Identifies broken chains
- Prioritizes by business impact
- Suggests specific actions to resolve gaps

objects.title: TreeViewProvider component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/views/treeViewProvider.ts``

Provides the Requirements Explorer tree view:

- Implements VS Code TreeDataProvider
- Supports grouping by type, level, file, status
- Displays ID, title, level, status with icons
- Click to navigate to definition
- Context menu for actions
- Refresh and filter controls
- Orphaned requirements section
- Subscribes to index updates for auto-refresh

objects.title: RelationshipExplorerProvider component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/views/relationshipExplorerProvider.ts``

Provides the Relationship Explorer tree view:

- Shows incoming and outgoing relationships for selected requirement
- Groups relationships by direction (Incoming/Outgoing)
- Sub-groups by link type (satisfies, implements, etc.)
- Displays relationship items with direction icons
- Click to navigate to related requirement
- Updates automatically when selection changes in Requirements Explorer
- Bidirectional navigation between explorers

objects.title: ValidationCommand component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/commands/validation.ts``

Implements the deep validation command:

- "Rigr: Deep Validation" command
- Runs DeepValidationRunner
- Displays progress notification
- Shows results in output channel or webview

objects.title: BaselineCommands component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/commands/baseline.ts``

Implements baseline management commands:

- "Rigr: Tag Current Baseline"
- "Rigr: Remove Baseline Tags"
- Prompts for baseline name
- Validates baseline eligibility
- Applies tags to eligible requirements
- Reports tagged count

objects.title: ReportCommands component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/commands/reports.ts``

Implements report generation commands:

- "Rigr: Generate Release Report"
- Collects data from index
- Formats Markdown report
- Includes summary, changes, coverage sections
- Saves to docs/releases/ directory

objects.title: ProjectCommands component
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/commands/project.ts``

Implements project creation commands:

- "Rigr: New Project"
- Template selection (minimal, standard, automotive)
- Creates docs/conf.py with configuration
- Creates example requirements structure
- Creates .vscode/settings.json

**Templates file**: ``src/commands/templates.ts``
**Test file**: ``src/commands/project.test.ts``

objects.title: IdGenerator utility
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/utils/idGenerator.ts``

Generates unique requirement IDs:

- Tracks all existing IDs in project
- Computes next sequential number
- Applies configured prefix and padding
- Guarantees project-wide uniqueness

**Test file**: ``src/utils/idGenerator.test.ts``

objects.title: GraphAnalysis utility
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/utils/graphAnalysis.ts``

Provides graph operations for validation:

- Builds adjacency lists from link graph
- Cycle detection algorithms
- Transitive closure computation
- Path finding for coverage analysis

**Test file**: ``src/utils/graphAnalysis.test.ts``

objects.title: Core type definitions
objects.description:
**File**: ``src/types.ts``

Defines all TypeScript interfaces:

- ObjectType, Level, IdConfig, LinkType, Status
- RigrConfig - complete configuration
- RequirementObject - parsed requirement
- RequirementIndex - index structure
- DiagnosticType enum
- ValidationIssue, DeepValidationResult
- ExtensionSettings
- ParsedRstFile, RequirementReference

objects.title: Implementation coverage summary
objects.description:
**Implemented Features** (traced to requirements above):

- Configuration: conf.py loading, VS Code settings, defaults
- Indexing: RST parsing, index building, caching
- IntelliSense: completion, hover, definition, references
- Validation: automatic diagnostics, deep validation with all DV checks
- UI: tree view, status bar
- Commands: validation, baseline, reports, project creation

**Test Coverage**:

- rstParser.test.ts - RST parsing
- circularDependencyDetector.test.ts - Cycle detection
- deepValidation.test.ts - Deep validation
- idGenerator.test.ts - ID generation
- defaults.test.ts - Default configuration
- graphAnalysis.test.ts - Graph utilities
- project.test.ts - Project creation

**Not Yet Implemented** (requirements in draft status):

- 00124 through 00129: Interactive traceability matrix and graph webviews
- 00133, 00134: Historical trend analysis, compliance reporting
- 00163 through 00165: Git tag integration
- 00171: Baseline timeline view
- 00206 through 00208: Webview panels for reports

objects.title: Extension activation time
objects.description:
The extension SHALL activate within 2 seconds on a standard
development machine.

objects.title: Initial index build time
objects.description:
Initial workspace indexing SHALL complete within 5 seconds for
projects with up to 500 requirements.

objects.title: Incremental index update time
objects.description:
Incremental index updates (on file save) SHALL complete within
500 milliseconds.

objects.title: Autocomplete response time
objects.description:
Autocomplete suggestions SHALL appear within 300 milliseconds
of user input.

objects.title: Validation response time
objects.description:
Automatic validation per file SHALL complete within 1 second
to avoid blocking the editor.

objects.title: Performance timing parameters
objects.description:
Performance targets summary:

- Activation: < 2 seconds
- Initial index (500 reqs): < 5 seconds
- Incremental update: < 500ms
- Autocomplete: < 300ms
- Validation per file: < 1 second

objects.title: Maximum file count
objects.description:
The extension SHALL handle workspaces with up to 1000 RST files
without significant performance degradation.

objects.title: Maximum requirement count
objects.description:
The extension SHALL handle projects with up to 10,000 requirements
while maintaining acceptable performance.

objects.title: Scale limit notification
objects.description:
When limits are exceeded, the extension SHALL:

- Display a notification suggesting exclusion patterns
- Continue operating with degraded performance
- Not crash or become unresponsive

objects.title: Memory usage limit
objects.description:
Memory usage SHALL remain under 200MB for projects within
the supported scale limits.

objects.title: Scalability parameters
objects.description:
Soft limits for optimal performance:

- Maximum files: 1000
- Maximum requirements: 10,000
- Memory budget: 200MB

objects.title: Graceful configuration degradation
objects.description:
If conf.py parsing fails, the extension SHALL:

- Fall back to default configuration
- Display notification about fallback
- Continue providing basic functionality

objects.title: Index persistence and recovery
objects.description:
The cached index SHALL be persisted to disk so that:

- No data is lost on VS Code restart
- Recovery is automatic on next activation
- Corrupted cache is detected and rebuilt

objects.title: Malformed RST handling
objects.description:
The parser SHALL handle malformed RST gracefully:

- Skip unparseable sections
- Report errors as diagnostics
- Continue processing remainder of file
- Never crash the extension

objects.title: Concurrent operation safety
objects.description:
The extension SHALL handle concurrent operations safely:

- Multiple file saves in quick succession
- User actions during indexing
- Background operations with UI interaction

objects.title: Error recovery
objects.description:
After any error, the extension SHALL:

- Log error details to output channel
- Remain operational for other features
- Provide recovery action if possible

objects.title: Zero configuration basic usage
objects.description:
Users SHALL be able to use basic features (parsing, navigation,
completion) without any configuration.

objects.title: Progressive disclosure
objects.description:
Advanced features SHALL be opt-in:

- Deep validation is command-triggered
- Complex settings have reasonable defaults
- Power features are discoverable but not intrusive

objects.title: Clear error messages
objects.description:
Error messages SHALL:

- Describe what went wrong clearly
- Suggest actionable resolution steps
- Include relevant context (file, line, ID)

objects.title: Consistent terminology
objects.description:
The extension SHALL use consistent terminology:

- "Requirement" for all item types (generic)
- "Object" when referring to any item type
- Configuration term alignment with conf.py

objects.title: Discoverability
objects.description:
Features SHALL be discoverable through:

- Command palette with clear command names
- Context menus where appropriate
- Hover tooltips on settings
- Status bar quick actions

objects.title: VS Code version compatibility
objects.description: The extension SHALL support VS Code version 1.80.0 and later.

objects.title: Python version compatibility
objects.description:
For conf.py parsing, the extension SHALL support Python 3.7
and later.

objects.title: Operating system compatibility
objects.description:
The extension SHALL work on:

- Windows 10/11
- macOS 10.15+
- Linux (Ubuntu 20.04+, Fedora 34+)

objects.title: Sphinx compatibility
objects.description:
The RST format SHALL be compatible with Sphinx versions 4.x
through 7.x for documentation building.

objects.title: Compatibility parameters
objects.description:
Minimum version requirements:

- VS Code: 1.80.0
- Python: 3.7
- Sphinx: 4.0
- Node.js (for extension): 18.x

objects.title: Unit test coverage
objects.description:
Unit tests SHALL achieve minimum 80% code coverage for:

- Configuration parsing
- RST parsing
- Index building
- ID generation
- Graph analysis

objects.title: Unit test cases
objects.description:
Unit tests SHALL cover:

- Various conf.py formats and edge cases
- All RST directive types and malformed input
- Incremental index updates
- Circular dependency detection
- Coverage calculation

objects.title: Integration tests
objects.description:
Integration tests SHALL verify:

- Full indexing workflow
- Provider responses (completion, hover, definition)
- Validation diagnostic accuracy
- Command execution end-to-end

objects.title: Test fixtures
objects.description:
Test fixtures SHALL include:

- Sample conf.py files with various configurations
- RST files with different requirement types
- Multi-file project structure
- Edge cases (empty files, malformed content)

objects.title: Test fixture structure
objects.description:
Test fixture structure:

.. code-block:: text

   test-fixtures/
   +-- docs/
   |   +-- conf.py
   |   +-- requirements/
   |       +-- stakeholder.rst
   |       +-- system.rst
   |       +-- component.rst
   +-- design/
   |   +-- architecture.rst
   +-- .vscode/
       +-- settings.json

objects.title: README documentation
objects.description:
README.md SHALL include:

- Installation instructions (VSIX and marketplace)
- Quick start guide with screenshots
- Feature overview
- Configuration guide
- Keyboard shortcuts table
- Troubleshooting section

objects.title: Usage documentation
objects.description:
USAGE.md SHALL include:

- Step-by-step workflows
- How to create requirements
- How to use autocomplete and navigation
- How to run validation
- How to create baselines and reports
- Best practices

objects.title: Contributing documentation
objects.description:
CONTRIBUTING.md SHALL include:

- Development setup instructions
- How to build and test
- Code structure explanation
- How to add new features
- Pull request guidelines

objects.title: In-code documentation
objects.description:
Source code SHALL include:

- JSDoc comments on public APIs
- Inline comments for complex logic
- Type definitions with descriptions

objects.title: Example project
objects.description:
Documentation SHALL include example project:

- Example conf.py with comments explaining options
- Example requirements.rst files
- Sample project structure demonstrating features

objects.title: Configuration parsing accuracy
objects.description:
The extension SHALL correctly parse conf.py with arbitrary
object types, levels, and link types as defined by users.

objects.title: Validation accuracy
objects.description:
Broken link detection SHALL have:

- 100% accuracy (no false negatives)
- Zero false positives

objects.title: Authoring efficiency
objects.description:
Time to create a new requirement SHALL be reduced from ~2 minutes
(manual typing) to <30 seconds (using snippets and autocomplete).

objects.title: Report accuracy
objects.description:
Generated baseline reports SHALL accurately reflect the actual
requirement state with 100% accuracy.

objects.title: Minimum viable product scope
objects.description:
MVP (v1.0.0) deliverables:

- Configuration loading from conf.py
- Requirement indexing (all types/levels)
- IntelliSense (autocomplete, hover, go-to-def)
- Dynamic snippets from config
- Tree view (basic grouping)
- Automatic validation (broken links, duplicates)
- Deep validation command
- Baseline tagging
- Release report generation

objects.title: Future enhancement scope
objects.description:
Future enhancements (v1.1+):

- Language Server Protocol implementation
- Traceability matrix visualization
- Full GitHub API integration
- Diff view for requirement changes
- Export to PDF/HTML
- Collaborative features
- Issue tracker integration

objects.title: Version-controlled requirements
objects.description:
Stakeholders shall be able to track which requirements were included
in specific product releases for auditing and compliance.

objects.title: Release documentation
objects.description:
For each release, stakeholders shall have access to comprehensive
documentation of requirements, coverage, and changes.

objects.title: Change tracking
objects.description:
Stakeholders shall be able to see what requirements changed between
releases to understand evolution and impact.

objects.title: Baseline field support
objects.description:
The extension shall support a ``:baseline:`` field on requirement
objects to indicate inclusion in a specific release.

Example: ``:baseline: v1.0.0``

objects.title: Tag current baseline command
objects.description:
The extension shall provide a command "Rigr: Tag Current Baseline":

1. Prompt for baseline name (e.g., "v1.0.0")
2. Add ``:baseline: v1.0.0`` to eligible requirements
3. Report count of tagged requirements

objects.title: Baseline eligibility
objects.description:
Only requirements meeting criteria shall be eligible for baseline:

- Status must be "approved" or "implemented"
- Option to filter by type, level, or file pattern

objects.title: Baseline selection options
objects.description:
Tag command shall support selection options:

- All eligible requirements
- By type filter
- By level filter
- By file/folder pattern
- Manual multi-select

objects.title: Remove baseline tags command
objects.description:
The extension shall provide "Rigr: Remove Baseline Tags" command
to remove baseline field from selected requirements.

objects.title: Tree view baseline filter
objects.description:
The tree view shall support filtering to show only requirements
with a specific baseline tag.

objects.title: Status bar baseline selector
objects.description:
The status bar shall display a baseline selector dropdown:

- "All" - Show all requirements
- "v1.0.0" - Show only v1.0.0 baseline
- Count: "Baseline v1.0.0 (87 requirements)"

objects.title: Baseline comparison
objects.description:
The extension shall support comparing two baselines:

- Show requirements added in newer baseline
- Show requirements modified between baselines
- Show requirements removed from baseline

objects.title: Generate release report command
objects.description:
The extension shall provide "Rigr: Generate Release Report" command
to create comprehensive release documentation.

objects.title: Report summary section
objects.description:
Release report shall include summary:

- Total requirements count
- Breakdown by status (approved, implemented)
- Breakdown by type
- Breakdown by level
- Generation timestamp

objects.title: Report changes section
objects.description:
Release report shall include changes since previous baseline:

- New requirements (IDs and titles)
- Modified requirements (field changes)
- Removed requirements
- Status transitions

objects.title: Report coverage section
objects.description:
Release report shall include traceability coverage:

- Coverage percentage per level transition
- List of requirements with incomplete coverage
- Visual coverage matrix

objects.title: Report output format
objects.description:
Release report format shall be Markdown with:

.. code-block:: markdown

   # Requirements Release Report: v1.0.0
   Generated: 2025-01-06

   ## Summary
   - Total requirements: 87
   - By status:
     - Approved: 65
     - Implemented: 22
   ...

   ## New Requirements (since v0.9.0)
   - 00042: System shall support...
   ...

   ## Traceability Coverage
   - stakeholder -> system: 95% (40/42)
   ...

objects.title: Report save location
objects.description:
Default report save location: ``docs/releases/release-{version}.md``

User may specify alternative location via dialog.

objects.title: Report export formats
objects.description:
Release reports shall be exportable in formats:

- Markdown (default)
- HTML (standalone)
- PDF (via HTML conversion)

objects.title: Create Git tag for baseline
objects.description:
The extension shall provide "Rigr: Create Git Tag for Baseline"
command to create an annotated Git tag.

objects.title: Git tag format
objects.description:
Git tag shall be created with:

- Tag name: ``req-{baseline}`` (e.g., ``req-v1.0.0``)
- Annotation: Requirement count and summary
- Option to use custom tag name

objects.title: Git integration prerequisites
objects.description:
Git commands shall require:

- Workspace is a Git repository
- No uncommitted changes to requirements files
- User confirmation before creating tag

objects.title: Git tag scope limitation
objects.description:
Full GitHub Release creation via GitHub Actions is out of scope.
The extension provides markdown reports that can be attached to
releases manually or via CI/CD pipelines.

objects.title: Baseline completeness validation
objects.description:
When tagging a baseline, the extension shall validate:

- All linked dependencies are also baselined (or warn)
- No draft/review status items in baseline
- Coverage thresholds are met

objects.title: Baseline dependency check
objects.description:
The extension shall warn if a baselined requirement links to
a non-baselined requirement (baseline leakage).

objects.title: Pre-baseline checklist
objects.description:
Before baseline creation, show checklist:

- [ ] All requirements approved/implemented
- [ ] No broken links
- [ ] Coverage thresholds met
- [ ] No circular dependencies
- [ ] Dependencies baselined

objects.title: Baseline history tracking
objects.description:
The extension shall maintain a history of baselines:

- List of all baseline versions
- Timestamp of each baseline creation
- Requirement counts per baseline

objects.title: Baseline timeline view
objects.description:
Future: Display timeline showing:

- Baseline versions chronologically
- Requirement count growth
- Major changes highlighted

objects.title: BaselineManager implementation
objects.description:
The BaselineManager component shall:

- Track all baseline tags in workspace
- Apply baseline tags via document edits
- Validate baseline eligibility
- Query requirements by baseline

objects.title: ReportGenerator implementation
objects.description:
The ReportGenerator component shall:

- Collect data from index for baseline
- Format Markdown/HTML report
- Compute change delta from previous baseline
- Generate coverage metrics section

objects.title: GitIntegration implementation
objects.description:
The GitIntegration component shall:

- Check Git repository status
- Create annotated tags via Git CLI
- Handle errors gracefully
- Not require Git extension dependency

objects.title: Real-time error detection
objects.description:
Requirements engineers shall be notified of errors and inconsistencies
in real-time while editing, before documentation is built or published.

objects.title: Release readiness verification
objects.description:
Before release, stakeholders shall be able to verify complete traceability
coverage and identify any gaps or inconsistencies.

objects.title: Actionable error resolution
objects.description:
When errors are detected, users shall be provided with clear guidance
and quick actions to resolve them.

objects.title: Hybrid validation approach
objects.description:
The extension shall implement a hybrid validation strategy:

- Automatic validation: Lightweight checks on save (fast)
- Deep validation: Comprehensive analysis on command (thorough)

objects.title: Rationale for hybrid approach
objects.description:
Hybrid validation balances responsiveness with thoroughness:

- Automatic checks catch common errors instantly
- Deep checks avoid performance impact during editing
- Users control when to run expensive analysis

objects.title: Automatic validation trigger
objects.description:
Automatic validation shall be triggered on file save with
configurable debouncing (default: 500ms).

objects.title: Broken link detection
objects.description:
The extension shall detect and report links to non-existent
requirement IDs as ERROR diagnostics.

objects.title: Duplicate ID detection
objects.description:
The extension shall detect and report duplicate IDs (same ID
defined multiple times) as ERROR diagnostics with all locations.

objects.title: Invalid type detection
objects.description:
The extension shall detect type field values not in configured
``rigr_object_types`` as ERROR diagnostics.

objects.title: Invalid level detection
objects.description:
The extension shall detect level field values not in configured
``rigr_levels`` as ERROR diagnostics.

objects.title: Invalid status detection
objects.description:
The extension shall detect status field values not in configured
``rigr_statuses`` as WARNING diagnostics.

objects.title: Missing required fields
objects.description:
The extension shall detect missing required fields:

- Missing ``:id:`` - ERROR
- Missing ``:type:`` - WARNING
- Missing ``:level:`` - WARNING

objects.title: Syntax error detection
objects.description:
The extension shall detect malformed RST directive syntax
as ERROR diagnostics with position information.

objects.title: Deep validation command
objects.description:
The extension shall provide a command "Rigr: Deep Validation"
for comprehensive analysis that is too expensive for real-time.

objects.title: Deep validation output
objects.description:
Deep validation shall generate an HTML report with:

- Executive summary with key metrics
- Detailed findings by category
- Interactive visualizations
- Actionable recommendations

objects.title: Cycle detection in dependency graph
objects.description:
Deep validation SHALL detect all cycles in the requirements
dependency graph formed by link relationships.

objects.title: Minimal cycle identification
objects.description:
The extension SHALL identify minimal cycles (shortest path
forming the cycle) to aid in resolution.

objects.title: Cycle path reporting
objects.description:
Cycles SHALL be reported with full path:

``00001 -> 00002 -> 00005 -> 00001``

objects.title: Cycle severity levels
objects.description:
Cycles SHALL be flagged by severity:

- ERROR: Direct circular dependency (A -> B -> A)
- WARNING: Longer cycles (A -> B -> C -> A)

objects.title: Cycle break suggestion
objects.description:
The extension SHALL provide "Break cycle at link" quick fix
suggesting which link to remove to break the cycle.

objects.title: Hierarchical coverage calculation
objects.description:
Deep validation SHALL calculate coverage for each level transition:

- Forward coverage: % of upper-level items with downstream links
- Backward coverage: % of lower-level items with upstream links

objects.title: Coverage by link type
objects.description:
Coverage SHALL be computed per configured link type:

- ``satisfies``: stakeholder -> system coverage
- ``implements``: system -> component coverage
- ``tests``: component -> test coverage

objects.title: Coverage report format
objects.description:
Coverage SHALL be reported as:

.. code-block:: text

   Traceability Coverage:
   - stakeholder -> system (satisfies):  42/45 (93%)  Good
   - system -> component (implements):   35/42 (83%)  Needs improvement
   - component -> test (tests):          28/35 (80%)  Needs improvement

objects.title: Coverage gap identification
objects.description:
Specific gaps SHALL be identified:

"00003, 00012, 00027 have no system implementation"

objects.title: Coverage threshold parameters
objects.description:
Configurable coverage thresholds:

- Good: >= 90%
- Warning: >= 70%
- Error: < 70%

objects.title: Orphan identification
objects.description:
Deep validation SHALL identify requirements with no incoming
OR outgoing links (true orphans).

objects.title: Orphan categorization
objects.description:
Orphans SHALL be categorized by type:

- True orphans: No links at all
- Dead-end items: Incoming links only (leaf nodes, may be valid)
- Source items: Outgoing links only (root nodes, may be valid)

objects.title: Orphan severity by priority
objects.description:
Orphan severity SHALL depend on priority:

- ERROR: Critical/high priority items with no links
- WARNING: Medium priority orphaned items
- INFO: Low priority or draft orphaned items

objects.title: Orphan link suggestions
objects.description:
The extension SHALL provide "Add link to..." quick fix with
suggestions based on:

- Same level matching
- Similar title text (fuzzy matching)
- Same file proximity

objects.title: Status mismatch detection
objects.description:
Deep validation SHALL detect status mismatches across links:

- ERROR: Approved requirement depends on draft requirement
- WARNING: Implemented depends on review-status requirement
- WARNING: Baselined links to non-baselined requirement

objects.title: Status transition validation
objects.description:
Status transitions SHALL be validated:

- Valid: draft -> review -> approved -> implemented
- ERROR: approved -> draft regression without justification

objects.title: Status inconsistency chain reporting
objects.description:
Inconsistency chains SHALL be reported:

.. code-block:: text

   Status Inconsistency Chain:
   00001 (approved) -> 00005 (draft) -> 00012 (approved)
                            ^ Problem here

objects.title: Bulk status update action
objects.description:
The extension SHALL provide "Update downstream statuses"
bulk action to resolve chains.

objects.title: Complete chain verification
objects.description:
Deep validation SHALL verify complete traceability chains:

For each stakeholder item, verify:
stakeholder -> system -> component -> test chain exists

Report: "00001 complete chain (4 levels), 00002 broken at system"

objects.title: Missing level detection
objects.description:
Level gaps SHALL be identified:

- Gap: 00001 -> 00005 (missing system intermediary)
- Report: "Direct jump from stakeholder to component - missing system"

objects.title: Bidirectional traceability validation
objects.description:
Bidirectional links SHALL be validated:

- Forward: stakeholder `satisfies` -> system
- Backward: system `satisfied_by` -> stakeholder
- ERROR if forward exists but backward missing

objects.title: Priority-weighted coverage calculation
objects.description:
Coverage SHALL be calculated weighted by priority:

.. code-block:: text

   Priority-Weighted Coverage:
   - Critical: 45/45 (100%)  PASS
   - High:     38/40 (95%)   PASS
   - Medium:   22/30 (73%)   WARNING
   - Low:      8/15  (53%)   INFO

objects.title: Priority coverage thresholds
objects.description:
Priority coverage targets:

- Critical: 100% required
- High: >= 95% target
- Medium: >= 85% target
- Low: >= 70% target

objects.title: High priority blocker
objects.description:
High-priority requirements with no implementation SHALL be
flagged as BLOCKER for release.

objects.title: Baseline status consistency
objects.description:
Deep validation SHALL verify baseline consistency:

- All baselined items must have stable status (approved/implemented)
- ERROR: Baselined item in draft or review status

objects.title: Baseline leakage detection
objects.description:
Baseline leakage SHALL be detected:

- WARNING: Baselined item links to non-baselined item
- Report: "00001 (v1.0.0) depends on 00005 (no baseline)"

objects.title: Baseline version conflicts
objects.description:
Version conflicts within baseline SHALL be reported:

All items in same baseline should have same version tag.

objects.title: Interactive traceability matrix
objects.description:
Deep validation SHALL generate an interactive matrix showing:

- Rows: Source level (stakeholder, system)
- Columns: Target level (system, component)
- Cells: Link count, link type, coverage indicator

objects.title: Matrix filtering
objects.description:
Matrix SHALL support filtering by:

- Link type (satisfies, implements, tests)
- Status (approved, draft, etc.)
- Priority level
- Baseline version

objects.title: Matrix export formats
objects.description:
Matrix SHALL be exportable as:

- HTML with clickable cells
- CSV for analysis in spreadsheet tools
- Markdown for documentation

objects.title: Dependency graph visualization
objects.description:
Deep validation SHALL generate a dependency graph showing:

- Nodes: Requirements colored by type and/or level
- Edges: Links labeled by link type
- Visual indicators: status, priority, baseline

objects.title: Graph layouts
objects.description:
Graph SHALL support layouts:

- Hierarchical: Top-down tree layout by level
- Circular: Cycle emphasis
- Force-directed: General overview

objects.title: Graph interactivity
objects.description:
Graph SHALL allow interactive navigation:

- Click node: Jump to definition
- Hover edge: Show link details
- Filter: By type/level/status/baseline

objects.title: Actionable gap identification
objects.description:
Gap analysis SHALL identify actionable items:

- Missing implementations: Stakeholder/system items with no downstream
- Orphaned implementations: Component/test items with no upstream
- Broken chains: Incomplete traceability paths

objects.title: Gap prioritization
objects.description:
Gaps SHALL be prioritized by business impact:

- BLOCKER: Critical requirements not implemented
- HIGH: High priority with poor coverage
- MEDIUM: Status inconsistencies
- LOW: Documentation gaps (orphaned info/rationale)

objects.title: Gap resolution suggestions
objects.description:
Specific actions SHALL be suggested:

- "Create system requirement to satisfy 00003"
- "Add test case for 00012"
- "Link 00008 to upstream 00002"

objects.title: Historical trend analysis
objects.description:
Future: Track coverage metrics over time (Git commits):

- Coverage improving/declining trends
- New orphaned requirements introduced
- Cycles added/removed
- Burndown chart for release readiness

objects.title: Compliance reporting
objects.description:
Future: Support regulatory compliance templates:

- ISO 26262 traceability requirements
- DO-178C traceability objectives
- IEC 62304 requirements tracing

objects.title: Diagnostic type enumeration
objects.description:
Supported diagnostic types:

- BrokenLink: ERROR - Links to non-existent ID
- DuplicateId: ERROR - ID defined multiple times
- CircularDep: WARNING - Circular dependency detected
- OrphanedReq: INFO - No links to/from requirement
- StatusInconsistent: WARNING - Approved links to draft
- InvalidStatus: WARNING - Status not in allowed list
- InvalidType: ERROR - Type not in rigr_object_types
- InvalidLevel: ERROR - Level not in rigr_levels
- MissingType: WARNING - Type field missing
- MissingLevel: WARNING - Level field missing
- MissingId: ERROR - ID field missing

objects.title: Diagnostic display
objects.description:
Diagnostics SHALL be displayed via:

- Inline squiggly underlines (red for error, yellow for warning)
- Problems panel categorized by file
- Hover showing message with fix suggestions

objects.title: Quick fix code actions
objects.description:
The extension SHALL provide CodeActions for common fixes:

- Broken link -> "Create requirement [ID]" or "Remove link"
- Duplicate ID -> "Rename to [next-available-ID]"
- Orphaned req -> "Add link to..."
- Invalid status -> "Change to [valid-status]"
- Invalid type -> "Change to [valid-type]"
- Invalid level -> "Change to [valid-level]"
- Missing field -> "Add [field] field"

objects.title: Configurable validation behavior
objects.description:
Validation behavior SHALL be configurable via settings:

- ``rigr.validation.automatic``: Enable/disable (default: true)
- ``rigr.validation.onSave``: Validate on save (default: true)
- ``rigr.validation.debounceMs``: Debounce interval (default: 500)

objects.title: Configurable diagnostic severity
Efficient requirement authoring
objects.description:
Requirements engineers shall be able to create new requirements quickly
with minimal typing and without memorizing syntax or IDs.

objects.title: Easy requirement navigation
objects.description:
Users shall be able to navigate between linked requirements instantly
to understand relationships and trace dependencies.

objects.title: Contextual information access
objects.description:
Users shall be able to view requirement details without leaving
their current editing context.

objects.title: Completion trigger on directive start
objects.description:
When user types ".." at the start of a line (or with only whitespace
before cursor), the extension shall trigger an intelligent completion
menu showing available object type options.

objects.title: Object type completion items
objects.description:
The completion menu shall display items for each configured object type:

- "New Requirement"
- "New Rationale"
- "New Information"
- "New Parameter"
- "New Design Element"

objects.title: Snippet insertion on selection
objects.description:
Upon selection, the extension shall insert a complete snippet with:

- Correct ``.. item::`` directive
- Auto-generated unique ID
- Pre-filled ``:type:`` field matching selection
- Pre-filled ``:level:`` field (defaulting to current file's level)
- Placeholder fields for ``:status:`` and common fields
- Cursor positioned at first editable field (title)

objects.title: Tab navigation through fields
objects.description:
The snippet shall support Tab key navigation through editable fields,
moving cursor between title, type, status, links, and description.

objects.title: Auto-generated unique ID
objects.description:
The extension shall auto-generate the next available unique ID:

- Analyze existing IDs in the project
- Compute next sequential number
- Format with configured prefix and padding
- Guarantee project-wide uniqueness

objects.title: Link field completion
objects.description:
When editing link fields (``:satisfies:``, ``:implements:``, etc.),
the extension shall provide auto-completion of existing requirement IDs.

objects.title: Completion item format
objects.description:
Completion items shall display:

``ID - Title [type] [level] [status]``

Example: ``00001 - Single source of truth [requirement] [stakeholder] [approved]``

objects.title: Fuzzy filtering
objects.description:
Completion results shall support fuzzy matching, filtering by:

- ID prefix/substring
- Title keywords
- Type or level

objects.title: Inline reference completion
objects.description:
When typing ``:item:``, the extension shall trigger completion for
inline requirement references within description text.

objects.title: Completion sorting
objects.description:
Completion results shall be sorted by:

1. Relevance to filter text
2. Recently used IDs (if applicable)
3. Alphabetically by ID

objects.title: Documentation preview
objects.description:
Each completion item shall include documentation showing the full
requirement description for preview before selection.

objects.title: Hover on requirement ID
objects.description:
Hovering over a requirement ID shall display a popup with full
requirement metadata and description.

objects.title: Hover content format
objects.description:
Hover popup shall display:

- ID and title (header)
- Type, level, status fields
- Baseline tag (if present)
- Description text (truncated if long)
- Links section showing all relationships
- File location with line number

objects.title: Hover on link fields
objects.description:
Hovering over IDs within link field values shall show the same
hover information as hovering over the ID definition.

objects.title: Go to definition
objects.description:
Pressing F12 or Ctrl+Click on a requirement ID shall navigate to
the requirement's definition location in the workspace.

objects.title: Peek definition
objects.description:
Alt+F12 shall show the definition inline without navigating away
from the current file (VS Code Peek feature).

objects.title: Definition from any reference
objects.description:
Go-to-definition shall work from:

- Link field values (``:satisfies: 00001``)
- Inline references (``:item:`00001```)
- ID definition itself (no-op or show message)

objects.title: Find all references
objects.description:
Shift+F12 or "Find All References" command shall locate all mentions
of a requirement ID across the workspace.

objects.title: Reference locations
objects.description:
References shall include:

- The definition location
- All link field references
- All inline text references
- References in other file types (if configured)

objects.title: Reference preview
objects.description:
The references panel shall show context around each reference,
allowing users to understand usage before navigating.

objects.title: Dynamic snippet generation
objects.description:
Snippets shall be generated dynamically from configuration:

- One snippet per configured object type
- Prefix pattern: ``item-<type>`` (e.g., ``item-requirement``)
- Fields populated from configured options

objects.title: Snippet template structure
Choice dropdowns
objects.description:
Enumerated fields (type, level, status) shall use VS Code choice
placeholders (``${n|opt1,opt2|}``) for quick selection.

objects.title: Custom user snippets
objects.description:
Users shall be able to define custom snippets in:

- VS Code user snippets settings
- ``.vscode/requirements.code-snippets`` in workspace

objects.title: New project command
objects.description:
The extension shall provide a command (Ctrl+Shift+P: "Rigr: New Project")
to create a new Rigr requirements management project.

objects.title: Project creation confirmation
objects.description:
Before creating a project, the extension shall prompt the user for
confirmation with options to proceed or cancel.

objects.title: Project template selection
objects.description:
The user shall be able to select from available templates:

- Minimal: Basic structure with minimal configuration
- Standard: Common structure for general projects
- Automotive: Structure suited for automotive/embedded systems

objects.title: Generated project structure
objects.description:
Created project shall include:

- ``docs/conf.py`` with Rigr configuration
- ``docs/requirements/index.rst`` with overview
- Example requirement file(s)
- ``.vscode/settings.json`` with recommended settings

objects.title: Structured requirement storage
objects.description:
Requirements shall be stored in a structured, human-readable format
that supports version control and diff/merge operations.

objects.title: Fast requirement lookup
objects.description:
The extension shall provide instant access to requirement information
during editing, without noticeable delay.

objects.title: Rationale for RST format
objects.description:
RST (reStructuredText) is chosen as the storage format because:

- Plain text, version control friendly
- Sphinx ecosystem for documentation generation
- Directive syntax allows structured metadata
- Human-readable without special tools

objects.title: Core object structure
objects.description:
Each requirement object shall contain the following properties:

- id: Project-unique identifier
- type: Object type from configuration
- level: Hierarchy level from configuration
- title: Short descriptive title
- description: Full description text
- status: Current status value
- links: Map of link type to target IDs
- metadata: Additional custom fields
- location: File path and line number

objects.title: Optional object fields
objects.description:
The following object fields are optional:

- baseline: Release baseline tag (e.g., "v1.0.0")
- priority: Requirement priority level
- author: Requirement author
- created: Creation date
- modified: Last modification date

objects.title: Link storage format
objects.description:
Links shall be stored as comma-separated ID lists in link type fields,
supporting multiple targets per link type.

Example: ``:satisfies: 00001, 00002``

objects.title: Item directive parsing
objects.description:
The extension shall parse the ``.. item::`` RST directive with the
following structure:

.. code-block:: rst

   .. item:: Title text
      :id: 00001
      :type: requirement
      :level: system
      :status: approved
      :satisfies: 00002

      Description content here.

objects.title: Field list parsing
objects.description:
The parser shall extract all field list entries (`:field: value`)
following the directive, mapping them to object properties.

objects.title: Multi-line description parsing
objects.description:
The parser shall correctly handle multi-line and multi-paragraph
description content, preserving formatting.

objects.title: Inline reference parsing
objects.description:
The parser shall detect inline RST references to other requirements
using the ``:item:`ID``` syntax within description text.

objects.title: Robust error handling
objects.description:
The parser shall handle malformed RST gracefully:

- Skip unparseable directives with warning
- Continue parsing remaining content
- Report parse errors as diagnostics

objects.title: Required field validation
objects.description:
The parser shall validate that required fields are present:

- id: Always required
- type: Required (warn if missing)
- level: Required (warn if missing)

objects.title: In-memory requirement index
objects.description:
The extension shall maintain an in-memory index of all parsed
requirement objects for fast lookup and navigation.

objects.title: Primary index by ID
objects.description:
The primary index shall be a map from requirement ID to the full
RequirementObject, providing O(1) lookup by ID.

objects.title: Secondary indexes
objects.description:
Secondary indexes shall be maintained for efficient queries:

- fileIndex: Map<file path, Set<ID>>
- typeIndex: Map<type, Set<ID>>
- levelIndex: Map<level, Set<ID>>
- statusIndex: Map<status, Set<ID>>

objects.title: Link graph index
objects.description:
A bidirectional link graph shall track all requirement relationships:

- Forward links: source ID -> Set<target IDs>
- Backward links: target ID -> Set<source IDs>
- Automatic computation of reverse links

objects.title: Baseline index
objects.description:
A baseline index shall map baseline tags to sets of requirement IDs
for baseline filtering and reporting.

objects.title: RST file discovery
objects.description:
The extension shall scan the workspace for all .rst files on
activation and when workspace folders change.

objects.title: Exclude pattern support
objects.description:
The scanner shall respect exclude patterns from configuration:

- Default excludes: ``**/build/**``, ``**/_build/**``, ``**/node_modules/**``
- User-configurable via settings

objects.title: Initial full scan
objects.description:
On activation, the extension shall perform a full scan of all RST
files, displaying progress notification for large workspaces.

objects.title: Incremental updates
objects.description:
On file save, only the changed file shall be re-parsed, with
affected indexes updated incrementally.

objects.title: File watcher
objects.description:
The extension shall watch for file system events (create, modify,
delete) and update the index accordingly.

objects.title: Index caching
objects.description:
The parsed index shall be cached to disk for faster startup:

- Location: ``.vscode/requirements-index.json``
- Revalidated against file modification times on load

objects.title: Cache invalidation
objects.description:
The cache shall be invalidated when:

- Configuration changes (conf.py modified)
- Extension version changes
- User requests manual rebuild

objects.title: Cache format
objects.description:
Cache JSON structure includes:

- version: Cache format version
- timestamp: Last update time
- configHash: Hash of configuration for invalidation
- objects: Serialized requirement objects
- references: File-to-references mapping

objects.title: Single source of truth for configuration
objects.description:
The extension shall use a single, authoritative source for project configuration
to avoid synchronization issues and ensure consistency across tools.

objects.title: Zero-configuration startup
objects.description:
Users shall be able to use the extension immediately without mandatory
configuration, with sensible defaults for common use cases.

objects.title: Rationale for Sphinx integration
objects.description:
Sphinx conf.py is chosen as the primary configuration source because:

- Most RST-based documentation projects already use Sphinx
- Avoids duplication of configuration between docs and editor
- Enables consistent behavior between Sphinx build and VS Code editing

objects.title: Primary configuration source
objects.description:
The extension SHALL read its primary configuration from the Sphinx ``conf.py``
file to ensure single source of truth with the documentation build system.

objects.title: Configuration file discovery
objects.description:
The extension shall search for conf.py in the following locations (in order):

1. ``docs/conf.py`` relative to workspace root
2. ``conf.py`` in workspace root
3. User-specified path via VS Code settings

objects.title: Python configuration extraction
objects.description:
The extension shall parse Python configuration by executing a Python script
to extract configuration as JSON, with fallback to AST parsing if Python
is unavailable.

objects.title: Configuration variables to extract
objects.description:
The extension shall extract the following configuration from conf.py:

- ``rigr_object_types``: Object type definitions
- ``rigr_levels``: Hierarchy level definitions
- ``rigr_link_types``: Relationship type definitions
- ``rigr_statuses``: Status value definitions
- ``rigr_id_config``: ID format configuration

objects.title: Configurable object types
objects.description:
The extension shall support user-defined object types with the following
properties: type (identifier), title (display name), color (visualization),
and style (rendering hint).

objects.title: Default object types
objects.description:
Default object types shall include:

- requirement: Primary functional requirements
- rationale: Justification for requirements
- information: Supporting context
- parameter: Configurable values
- design_element: Architectural decisions

objects.title: Configurable hierarchy levels
objects.description:
The extension shall support user-defined hierarchy levels defining
abstraction tiers in the requirements structure. Levels are stored
as a ``:level:`` attribute, independent of the ID.

objects.title: Default hierarchy levels
objects.description:
Default hierarchy levels shall include:

- stakeholder: High-level user/business requirements
- system: System-level functional requirements
- component: Component-level specifications
- software: Software implementation requirements
- hardware: Hardware implementation requirements

objects.title: Configurable link types
objects.description:
The extension shall support user-defined link types with:

- option: Field name used in RST (e.g., "satisfies")
- incoming: Reverse link name (e.g., "satisfied_by")
- outgoing: Forward link name (e.g., "satisfies")
- style: Optional visual styling

objects.title: Default link types
objects.description:
Default link types shall include:

- satisfies/satisfied_by: Vertical traceability
- implements/implemented_by: Implementation links
- derives_from/derives_to: Derivation relationships
- tests/tested_by: Verification links

objects.title: Configurable status values
objects.description:
The extension shall support user-defined status values with labels and
optional colors for visual indication.

objects.title: Default status values
objects.description:
Default status values shall include:

- draft: Initial creation
- review: Under review
- approved: Approved for implementation
- implemented: Implementation complete
- deprecated: No longer valid

objects.title: Configurable ID format
objects.description:
The extension shall support configurable ID format with:

- prefix: Optional prefix string (e.g., "REQ")
- separator: Character between prefix and number (e.g., "-")
- padding: Number of digits with leading zeros (e.g., 5 for "00001")
- start: Starting number for auto-increment

objects.title: Project-unique IDs
objects.description:
IDs shall be semantically neutral and globally unique within the project.
The ID does not encode type, level, or location information.

objects.title: ID format parameters
objects.description:
Default ID configuration parameters:

- prefix: "" (empty, no prefix)
- separator: "-"
- padding: 5 (e.g., "00001")
- start: 1

objects.title: Fallback configuration
objects.description:
If no conf.py is found or parsing fails, the extension shall use a
minimal default configuration that enables basic functionality.

objects.title: Graceful degradation
objects.description:
The extension shall continue operating with defaults when configuration
parsing fails, displaying a notification about the fallback.

objects.title: Extension-specific settings
objects.description:
The extension shall support VS Code settings.json for user-configurable
extension behavior that is separate from project configuration.

objects.title: Validation settings
objects.description:
Validation behavior settings shall include:

- ``rigr.validation.automatic``: Enable/disable automatic validation
- ``rigr.validation.onSave``: Validate on file save
- ``rigr.validation.debounceMs``: Debounce interval (default: 500ms)

objects.title: UI preference settings
objects.description:
UI preference settings shall include:

- ``rigr.treeView.groupBy``: Grouping mode (type/file/status/level)
- ``rigr.treeView.showStatusIcons``: Show status icons in tree

objects.title: Performance settings
objects.description:
Performance settings shall include:

- ``rigr.indexing.maxFiles``: Maximum files to index (default: 1000)
- ``rigr.indexing.excludePatterns``: Glob patterns to exclude

objects.title: Validation debounce parameter
objects.description: Default validation debounce: 500 milliseconds

objects.title: Max files parameter
objects.description: Default maximum files to index: 1000 files

objects.title: Manual configuration reload
objects.description:
The extension shall provide a command "Rigr: Reload Configuration"
to manually reload configuration from conf.py.

objects.title: Automatic configuration reload
objects.description:
The extension shall automatically reload configuration when conf.py
is saved, without requiring manual refresh.

objects.title: Configuration status indicator
objects.description:
The status bar shall display configuration status:

- "Rigr: Ready (N objects)" when configuration is loaded successfully
- "Rigr: Config Error" when parsing failed (clickable to view error)

objects.title: Configuration change notification
objects.description:
When configuration changes affect existing objects (e.g., removed type),
the extension shall display a notification and re-validate all objects.
